全然クリアできなくて投げやりになってうわああああああって適当にマウスぶん回してたら何故かクリアしてしまったりする

もやもやした気分で頭より先に手を出してプレイしてしまうと、うっかりクリアしちゃったりなんかして釈然としない
わだかまりのようなものが出来たまま次のステージがアンロックされる
何というかうーんこの

因みに自分は寝落ちや退席時間を含めてで20時間以上プレイしてますが
一向に上級がクリアできなくて悲しくなったのでいったんアンインストールします

33392883.review:
I was a little hesitant to get this game when I saw that it was on sale for the summer sale, but seeing the low price I figured it was worth the risk and the worst that would happen is that I would get some trading cards that would recoup a little bit of the cost. It was surprisingly than I expected and I've compiled a list of pros and cons about the game.

Pros:

-Low cost for a game with a surprising amount of content

-A fair amount of strategy required for a game that's only about drawing a line on your screen

-Incredibly low stress game and its perfect for just sitting around

-Surprisingly a lot of ideas for such a simplistic concept

-Quick achievements, but also the "other achievements" which make you attempt the levels in a different fashion.

Cons:

-Gets a little repetitive for the more difficult levels. While the first few that you see in the advanced pack and maybe a couple of the others can be truly difficult, eventually you start seeing the same patterns and they fall in place easily for you.

Conclusion:
The game is well worth the price no matter how much you get it at. The game is a fantastic concept, which can be executed in a surprising amount of different ways. The achievements make you think about the levels in a little bit of a different way as well (if you care about those) and overall add another layer of difficiulty to the game. I loved the game other than the few "easier" levels due to repitition in the final advanced pack. Overall though, a solid 9/10 game well worth the price!

33360804.review:
[b]語彙力のないのが書きたいこと書いただけなのでおｋな方だけ[/b]
∟このレビューの投稿者は実績コンプする程度はプレイしています

[h1]まず俺個人としての評価としては[/h1]
∟一筆書きのパズルを舐めてかかることなかれ、難易度は高く、解けた達成感良し、操作性良し、デザイン良し！

[h1]【ゲームシステム】[/h1]
　ゲームシステムは線を引いて通るタイルの白黒を反転させて全部白にすればクリアっていう単純なもの。
　と単純とは書いたものの難易度は高い部類だと思う
　∟（投稿者はパズルゲーは苦手）

　初級、中級、上級とどんどん難易度が上がっていく、最初は8×8マスのタイルが最後には20×30とかになってそれを一筆となるとなかなかに凝固まった脳みそが動かない。本当に難しいが考えてて楽しいのが一筆書き。

　パズルの面は何かしらのモチーフがあり　魚の一筆書きだったり、帽子の一筆書きだったり、戦車の一筆書きもあったな、面を見てるだけで楽しめたりする。
　そしてパズルの面を自分で作れたりしちゃったりする。まぁ大抵はドット絵の餌食になるとはおもうが。

[h1]まとめると[/h1]
　何かの片手間に暇つぶしとしてしたいなーという時にはうってつけのゲームだとおもう。十分オススメできるねこれ

29438163.review: Fill all the black squares on the board with one sweep trajectory, able to make only quarter-clock turns. It may become more difficult than you think. You are able to overlap, but mind it will turn the focus square back to the opposite colour. There are special tiles which never change colour, always being compatible, to give you some room. [b]Unium[/b] is a simplistic game, very retro in outlooks, but it plays fine. There are plenty of gradually unlockable stages to go through, categorized into four different difficulty levels. There are challenging achievements to be obtained, oftentimes requiring to solve given riddle in a particular, alternate manner, adding to replayability. There is also a level editor, supported with STEAM Workshop, already full of contents. One thing which may bug is that currently [January 2017] [b]Unium[/b] loads up all the custom maps anew each time it is launched, causing the process to take some time if one has many of these items. Despite that, for the price of two Euro, the game offers a lot of mindstretching. Best in small doses.

29297763.review:
Das Spiel ist gut.

Das Prinzip der Rätsel ist tatsächlich simpel und man hat es ziemlich zufriedenstellend umgesetzt.

Ärgerlich kann sein, dass man die grauen (neutralen) Felder fast nicht von den weissen Feldern unterscheiden kann. Stilistisch mag dies beabsichtigt sein, weil die Spielfläche am Ende eines Levels weiss erscheinen soll, für das effektive Lösen der Rätsel ist das kontraproduktiv.

Der Schwierigkeitsgrad der Level schwankt (für mich) sehr stark. Die meisten Level waren entweder total einfach oder recht schwer.

Die Rätsel im Bereich Anfänger, Einfach und Mittel konnte ich binnen Sekunden lösen (es gab nur einen offensichtlichen Weg), ein paar nahmen ein paar Minuten in Anspruch (weil es mehrere mögliche Wege abzuklären galt).

Im Bereich Fortgeschrittene gibt es auch noch sehr einfache, aber auch Rätsel, die wirklich harte Nüsse für mich waren.

Das ist gut und insofern werden Rätselfans dort auf ihre Kosten kommen können (so teuer ist das Spiel ja nicht).

Kritisch anzumerken wäre aber (das ist mein Eindruck), dass ich die meisten dieser schwierigeren Rätsel nicht oder kaum durch logische Schlüsse lösen konnte. Es war eher ein probieren, weil es sehr viele mögliche Wege gab. Es gibt ein paar Erfahrungen die man macht, was gehen kann und was nicht, aber es ist schon viel "schauen wir mal" dabei. Hatte ich eine Lösung konnte ich selten irgendeine Erfahrung daraus zum Lösen weiterer Rätsel mitnehmen.

Insofern kann ich beide Seiten verstehen: Leute, die das Spiel gut finden ebenso wie solche, die es eher langweilig finden.

Die Musik zum Spiel fand ich ein wenig eintönig, aber noch OK.

Das Menü ist OK, allenfalls die stilisitische Weiss/Grau-Tönung machte es ein bisschen schwer, gelöste von ungelösten Rätseln zu unterscheiden.

Erfreulicherweise merkte sich das Spiel sogar halbgelöste Rätsel und hatte auch eine kleine Hilfe (ein möglicher Startpunkt).

Pro & Contra:

+ Teils schwierige Rätsel

o Lösungen durch Logik oder durch probieren? 

- Sehr viele sehr einfache Rätsel
- Graue Felder kaum von weissen Feldern unterscheidbar

Wertung: 07/10

Das Spiel bietet ein simples Rätselprinzip gut umgesetzt. Ob die Rätsel eher durch Versuch und Irrtum oder durch Nachdenken gelöst werden können und ob es einem entsprechend gefällt, muss man wohl selbst ausprobieren.

《Unium》是一款通过鼠标进行连线的解谜游戏。

24290825.review:
画线，是一款非常简约的益智小游戏，玩法差不多就是一笔画：找出一个起点，将画面上的黑色方块全部填充成为白色就过关了。

游戏共有4个难度，前面两个难度都很简单，从第三个难度开始才有些挑战。黑白分明的画面上，有些抽象的图案，需要玩家一气呵成来进行描绘。适合闲暇时拿出来玩一两关，但玩久会有些烧脑。

steam上类似一笔画玩法的游戏比较出名的还有LYNE，但本作和LYNE并不相同。LYNE有不同形状的图形，而且不要求首尾相连，一个图形连接一次还是多次都是事先规定好的。本作只有黑白色调，多数情况下需要首尾相连以填充图案中的每一个方块，线路是否交叉需要玩家自己的判断。两款游戏各有特色，难以一概而论。

简约风格，益智休闲，值得一试的小清新解谜游戏。

推荐一篇指南：
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=439774419

23347705.review:
As a puzzle enthusiast, I have came across many path-like puzzle games. Usually they seem alike, but have a small change in the formula to make them unique. That's the beauty of puzzle games. You change something small, and the bigger picture is that much different.

Unium is a basic path puzzle game involving black and white squares, much like the Polarium series. I had spent numerous hours playing Polarium, and as such I have developed a fondness for games similar to it.

Much like the hit smartphone game Flow, and the infamous LYNE, it relies on going through a path. Unfortunately, a setback with this sort of game is that you begin to see a pattern, which assists you in completing every puzzle. There is a bit of strategy involved, but not enough to keep strategists hooked on the game. You can probably solve nearly any puzzle just by figuring out where to start, which usually is incredibly obvious. (e.g having one block that can't be accessed when starting anywhere else)
The game is fairly easy but is entertaining and has a vast amount of workshop puzzles. It's worth the price. Although I got mine free, I would have had no problem paying the actual price for this game.

It makes me hope that Kittehface Software makes more puzzle games in the future. Cuz I'd totally buy the hell outta that.

[b]Draw with one line puzzle.[/b] This is a nice minimalist game with simple mechanics and perfect controls both on PC and mobile devices.
It may seem easy at the very beginning but it's definitely not: difficulty increases rather quickly. While first puzzles are solvable in less than a minute, the last section brings the real challenge. Solving it without in-game hints or guides will require tens of hours.
I am personally not a fan of sitting for 30+ minutes on single puzzle without any progress (there are 60 of them in the last section), so I used help for the advanced difficulty. It just wasn't for me. But the first three sections are totally doable and I recommend them to everyone. 3-4 hours to solve everything from easy to normal included. Last section - only for real puzzle-addicts as it require 10-∞ hours to solve everything. I admire people who created these levels and the one who solved them without any hints.

P.S. Even after the completion of the game you might eventually find yourself playing and enjoying this game again :)

This is a solid interactive puzzle in principle quite similar to LYNE. Some math related skills from Minesweeper and Rubic's cube could be utilized here too. Its black and white color scheme is surely dull so that nothing distracts you from pure spacial awareness logic. We need to interconnect a massive of squares with one pathway avoiding wrong squares and probably including the neutral ones. It offers clear intuitive rules and minimal interface which feels very 'tactile' with subtle use of animation and effects. It would be a proper addition to every game collection, for touchscreens as well.

Хорошая интерактивная головоломка по принципу схожая с ЛЫНИЕЙ. Также могут пригодиться математические навыки Сапера и кубика Рубика. Скучная черно-белая цветовая схема не отвлекает пользователя от чистой логики пространственной ориентации. Нам необходимо объединить массив квадратов одним маршрутом, избегая неправильных и возможно включая нейтральные. Здесь ясные, интуитивно понятные правила и минималистичный интерфейс, хорошо "тактильно" ощущаемый благодаря изящному применению анимаций и эффектов. Будет достойным дополнением любой игровой коллекции, и для телефона тоже.

20217716.review:
[i]UNIUM is an unconventional, small yet challenging puzzle game. Master the art of drawing lines through sets of different colored squares in order to advance to the next puzzle.[/i]

[h1][b][u]Design & Art[/u][/b][/h1]
The game is tinted in complete black and white, some greyscales included. Since UNIUM's main focus lies upon grids of squares, most of the design is quadratic as well. Don't expect anything fancy here, the design is just a backdrop for the actual gameplay, even if it looks a bit bland.

While most of the visual design is a bit lacking, UNIUM makes up for it in the [b][u]very creative design of the puzzles:[/u][/b] Most of them are shaped in some form, representing some real-life objects, which is very charming.

[h1][b][u]Controls[/u][/b][/h1]
The game is completely [u][b]controlled by mouse[/b][/u]. UNIUM offers no introductory tutorial, yet the first levels are easy enough for beginners to solve until you get the bigger hang of it.

[h1][b][u]Sound and Music[/u][/b][/h1]
The puzzle game features a small collection of music tracks, which one of is randomly selected once you start to solve a puzzle. All of them are [b][u]really subtle and eerie synths that loop. An option to turn off the soundtrack is available.[/u][/b] Also, the soundeffects sound fitting. Overall, the sound backdrop lightly supports the game in a positive manner, yet is easily forgettable (which is not a bad thing).

[h1][b][u]Gameplay[/u][/b][/h1]
UNIUM revolves around puzzles, which consist of a variable sized set of different colored squares. You need to [b][u]draw a line through the set of squares in order to tint all of them in one color[/u][/b] (hence the name of the game) and thus solve given puzzle to advance to the next puzzle. The game shares similarities with LYNE (a game I already reviewed), since both revolve around drawing lines between objects.

As you grow more experienced with different techniques and strategies, [b][u]puzzles will rise in difficulty as well as in quantity (over 50 puzzles on the highest difficulty)[/u][/b]. A nice design, keeping the easy puzzles small in number early on, yet later challenging you with a bigger amount of higher difficulty ones.

There is also a [b][u]semi-linear advancement;[/u][/b] If you are ripping your hair out at a certain puzzle, you can still try to solve the next one and advance, leaving one puzzle behind to solve for another day. Awesome!

While other games of the genre (e.g. LYNE) had some sort of random generator to keep the replayablity at least at some level, this game lives on through [b][u]user-generated puzzles integrated via Steam's Workshop objects.[/u][/b] Create your own puzzles in the ingame puzzle generator, which is really easy to use. Nice!

[h1][b][u]Weakpoints[/u][/b][/h1]
I noticed some really annoying [b][u]difficulty discrepancies[/u][/b] in my playthrough. On certain levels, I was close to bashing my head in for missing a really annoying aspect of the solution, wasting more time that was actually necessary in my opinion (sometimes more than 30 minutes). But when I tried the next level for some change, I solved it within two minutes. This really striked me as odd as this happened multiple times whilst playing, so it cannot be just out of luck.

The [b][u]clues for puzzles which you cannot seem to solve are really lacking.[/u][/b] You only get a starting point as a clue, which is not enough in my opinion if you are really struggling to solve a certain one.

Music can get annoying if played for too long, either do longer pauses or turn it off as explained above.

[h1][b][u]Concluding Thoughts[/u][/b][/h1]
[i]UNIUM feels like the little brother of LYNE. Fortunatly, little doesn't always mean weaker or less powerful. UNIUM really has it in it, a nice game for enthusiastic puzzle solvers who really enjoyed LYNE or puzzle games overall. Bland looking visuals and simplistic sound design are just the backdrop fo the head-bashingly hard puzzles. I really need to draw the line here (very punny). A solid recommendation for any puzzle solver out there. Happy solving![/i]

19323019.review:
I really enjoyed Unium.

You have to trace a line connecting all black tiles while avoiding the white ones. A few more mechanics are introduced further in the game, but it still manage to get challenging with a simple concept.

That being said, the difficulty is all over the place. The first 20-30 levels are extremely easy; even without thinking much, anyone would be able to complete them. On the other hand, the remaining levels build up in complexity. I'd almost say that main game is in the hard difficulty and everything else is a long tutorial. 

Beware of the ramping difficulty; it's nothing impossible, but you can easily get stuck. Truthfully, I still have to complete the 2-3 last levels.

There also are interesting achievements that suggest replaying earlier levels with a different method, wich I think was a nice addition.

My interest in this game lasted for a while, but not as much as Steam says. Please do not overthink my play time, I simply left the game open too long. 

Finally, I recommend this game. It's a good puzzle game and it's pretty cheap.

Тем, кому нравятся LYNE.

[h1]Насколько напрягает мозг?[/h1]
Сначала я думал, что я гений, решив несколько первых десятков уровней на лету с первого раза. Затем пришла сложность Medium — иногда уже застревал. Но вот когда дошёл до сложности Advanced/Расширенный (содержащей 60 уровней), то я тупил (точнее туплю — я застрял…) похлеще, чем в игре LYNE.

Суть игры в том, что надо превратить (пройтись по ним) чёрные квадратики в белые.

17974752.review:
This space-filling path simulator is very eloquent and well-polished. Good music, good visuals, good sound effects, and good puzzle design. With about a hundred puzzles and workshop support for more, it's a respectable entry in the abstract casual puzzle genre.

My only complaint is that it doesn’t do a good job of teaching you how to play it. Learning to draw the standard space-filling paths is simple enough – there’s only one principle to learn, and that is to never create more than one dead-end when drawing the path. This is adequate up to the “medium” puzzles, but upon entering the “advanced” puzzles, the game starts requiring you to cross the streams. Some black squares are now closed off behind formations of white squares, and you will be required to flip some of the white squares to black and then back to white by drawing crossroads through them. This introduces a handful of new principles to learn, but the game doesn’t teach them to you and isn’t structured to slowly demonstrate them one at a time. This will likely leave casual puzzlegoers relying mostly to trial-and-error until they find the solution on accident, and achievement hunters losing patience quickly and loading up a FAQ. (I’ll freely admit to looking up the answers for about a dozen of the puzzles.)

I feel like this game would have been one of my favorite causal puzzle games if it had about fifty more puzzles, and the “advanced” category had been split off into an additional, harder difficulty to teach all the flipping tricks in a reasonable order. As it is, the game’s certainly not bad, but just be warned that it might leave you with an empty feeling if you’re a particularly impatient gamer.

[b]July 3, 2015[/b]
Unium may feel in line ([i]heh[/i]) with some mobile puzzle games, but Steam is supported well enough to make it stand out on PC. The Workshop can add a lot of content to the game, while the base game is probably around 4 hours of puzzles. It's a cheap game with decent value.

The controls are simple, but dragging a line can suddenly stop if you move too fast. Early puzzles feel nice and introduce the game cleanly, but the Advanced puzzles can become overwhelming and repetitive. I feel that too many puzzles are pushed into the Advanced difficulty, reusing previous levels with minor changes. Overall, Unium is an interesting game, at least for awhile. Puzzle fans will likely find the full price to be fair. It's not classic or memorable, but still a solid game.

15757614.review:
Unium est un Puzzle Game simpliste mais pas simple... On peut le relier au jeu LYNE : même esprit (lignes, 2d, simple, intelligent, musique...). 
Si vous avez aimer LYNE, foncez pour celui-là !!
C'est aussi pour ça que pendant cette évaluation, je ferais souvent référence à LYNE en les comparant...

Le principe est très simple : des cases noires et blanches sur un tableau, l'objectif est de tracer une ligne qui permettra d'avoir un tableau tout blanc. Si on passe sur une case, elle change de couleur...
Sur le papier, c'est simple, mais dans les faits, c'est plutôt compliqué (comme LYNE) même si j'ai dû attendre d'arriver au niveau "Moyen" (Niveau 10 environ) pour commencer à réfléchir... 
Bien sûr, il y a des petites subtilités dans le gameplay : passer deux fois sur la même case et les cases neutres.
Unium repose entièrement sur ces simples règles.

Graphiquement, c'est très épuré : simple mais beau (juste noir et blanc).

La musique est discrète, douce, mais elle colle parfaitement avec l'ambiance du jeu (calme et posé).

Les niveaux sont en nombres plutôt important (environ une centaine) et très variés (même si LYNE en proposait plus de 600 !!)
Là ou LYNE était très abstrait, Unium représente une multitude de choses (voiture, manette, fleur...) gràçe à ses cases, me rapellant systématiquement le "Pixel Art", où chaque case (ou pixel) est soigneusement placé tout en alliant le gameplay au level design.
Aujourd'hui, le WorkShop de Unium est sorti, donc de nouvelles maps sortiront pour allonger la durée de vie (environ 5 heures je pense, mais qui dépend surtout si vous êtes fort ou si vous trichez), car comme beaucoup de Puzzle Game, ce jeu n'a aucune rejouabilité (à moins que vous essayez de finir un niveau d'une autre façon).

Par contre, j'aurais bien aimé changer les couleurs en débloquant assez de crédits (par exemple).
Comme LYNE quoi (on pouvait débloquer des triangles pour changer la palette de couleurs). Mais, bon, c'est pas trop important...

Pour conclure, Unium est un bon Puzzle Game, minimaliste et épuré, parfait pour ceux qui ont aimé LYNE ou ceux qui veulent découvrir de nouveaux jeux Indés où il faut réfléchir...

This game was a blast.  You can play it whether you have a little or a lot of time.  A warning though - it is addictive so "a little time" can easily turn into a lot if you have nowhere to be.

There's nothing bad to say really.  You'll only not like Unium if you're impatient or not into puzzle games.

The difficulty ramped up well - you'll probably breeze through the Beginner and Easy levels, then start slowing down mid-way through Medium until you find yourself spending potentially hours to crack some Advanced levels (the bulk of the game is in Advanced).

Half of the achievements also give some incentive to re-do a few levels with more constraints, giving them some new life.

The music provided a nice, unobtrusive ambience that worked even for hours of play at a time.

Unium is very polished for an indie game.  The UI, sound, achievements, level design, and length all feel perfectly cohesive. And it's 2 bucks!

15118430.review:
한붓그리기 게임.
룰도 재미도 간단하다. 검은 공간을 전부 채워서 흰색으로 만들면 된다. 그 생각하는 과정이 그 재미 자체이다.
그럼 "그냥 단순한 한붓그리기로 공간을 채우는게 아니냐?" 는 생각을 할 수 있겠지만 몇가지 요소를 더 집어넣어서 유저가 사고해야 할 양을 늘려준다.

1. 회색은 지나갈 수는 있지만, 채울 필요는 없다. 즉 활용을 해도, 안해도 되는 무방한 공간이 존재한다.
이 써도 안써도 된다는 묘하게 신경쓰이게 하는 존재가 "써야 할지", "무슨 의미로 배치를 해둔 공간"인지 묘하게 인지가 됨에도 루트 계산의 사고과정 자체에서는 종종 배제되는 등등의 여러가지 복합요소로 작용한다.

2. 이 게임은 기본적으로 검은 공간을 채워 흰 공간을 메꾸는 게임이지만, 흰 공간은 한번 더 지나가게 되면 검은색으로 변하고 다시 한번 더 지나가면 흰색으로 변한다. 즉 "교차"가 가능하다. 이러한 점 + 업적에서 교차점을 활용해보도록 요구한다는 점에서 루트를 여러번 생각해보게 한다.

가격도 낮은편이고 사서 할 값어치는 충분하다. 다만 머리쓰는 게임 자체를 싫어하는 쪽에 해당한다면 안 사는게 좋을 듯.

15102824.review:
The main aesthetics for this game are challenge and submission. It's a puzzle game (challenge) and it's repetitive enough that it's a good time waster (submission). The mechanics are simple as you just trace a path with your mouse and the line follows. The music is pretty soothing and something about the sound effects are pretty satisfying to hear, especially if you run your mouse down a line quickly. 

The game has 4 levels of difficulty and each level has a lot of puzzles. It's easy to get to the advance levels pretty quickly and there are about 60 advanced puzzles, so there isn't a lack of things to do. 

Pros: 
+ They advertise a puzzle game with a simple mechanic and that's exactly what you get. 
+ Difficulty tiers all have numerous puzzles so there's plenty to solve at your desired difficulty
+ Sound effects are fun. Music is soothing, though a little sleep inducing because it's so calm

Cons:
- Eventually you'll run out of levels (though there are specific achievements for specific puzzles)
- I have a short attention span so this isn't going to be a game that I'll play for a long time. 

In short, if you want a simple puzzle game that has varying levels of difficulty and you like what the screenshots have, then this is a pretty nice game to have.

15101663.review:
An incredibly simple mind-bending puzzle game that will draw you in and take all of your free time. After picking it up, I had trouble putting down, even when frustrated with the later puzzles.

The game itself is fairly easy to understand, and the basic mechanics are easy to grasp. However, despite the simplicity of understanding the game, mastering it is a completely different story. The game starts you off on the Beginner difficulty, but as you progress you will eventually unlock Easy, Medium, and then Advanced. The puzzles in Beginner are easy to understand and can be solved in minutes, but as more mechanics of the game are revealed to you (namely neutral tiles and crossing lines), the puzzles start to suck away more and more time. Some of the Advanced puzzles eventually ended up taking hours of my time as I struggled to figure out what to do. Despite the difficulty, they remained enjoyable.

The achievements, for all of those that enjoy 100%ing games, are split between two different kinds: complete X number of puzzles of a certain difficulty, and completing a certain puzzle in a certain way. The second type of achievement listed is actually a ton of fun to go for, as it requires you to go back to a familiar puzzle and look at it in a new way. These special challenges presented through the achievements gives you even more time with the game, although obviously not required to do so.

Overall, Unium is a complete blast to play and your time will disappear before you know what's happening. For the low price tag, even if you complete the Beginner/Easy puzzles, you'll be incredibly satisfied with the purchase. Unium is a fantastic, beautiful puzzle game that everybody should give a try at least once.

15085403.review:
■概要
ラインを引くと白黒が反転するタイルを一筆書きで繋ぎ、
全て白タイルへと変換するパズルゲーム。

■ゲームプレイ
マウスで線を引いて通過するタイルの白黒を反転させる。
全てのタイルが白色になればクリアとなる。

基本ルールは上記の通りシンプルであるが、
・二度通ると白黒が再度反転する（最大で2度までしか通れない）
・上を通っても色が反転しないニュートラルタイルが存在する
を組み合わせる事により、パズルとしての難易度はそれなりに高く、
後半の高難易度パズルとなると一筋縄ではいかない難解さ。

操作性は良好でその方面でのストレスは感じない。

■総合
シンプルなルールのもと、段階的な難易度の調整がされており、
考えば考えるほど状況が好転していく。
また、解法が一通りではなく「プレイヤーが解く実感」を得られるなど
パズルゲームとしてのバランスはそれなりに良くお勧め。

各パズルの所要時間は難易度に因るがそれ程長くならず、
状態が常に保存されているのでいつでも止められる親切設計。

ステージ数は100を優に超える。
（2015/3/28）

15083054.review: Pretty entertaining game with a simple enough task - draw a single line to turn all black tiles white - and a fair dose of puzzle (starting from the Medium levels anyway). Perfect for those days when you just don't feel like using more than one hand and half of your brain.

15080285.review:
Watch my "First Play on Launch Day" Video here:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XAGrcUNCX8Y

A simple.. but sometimes complex puzzle game that just "works".

You see progessively more complex black shapes that you must fill in completely with a single white line thus turning the entire picture white.  This is pretty fun, but it's knock is that it's almost easier to just keep randomly drawing lines until you eventually stumble across a path that works rather then requiring you to stop and think and plan out a route.

I think the game would be better if there were some sort of scoring system in place that rewarded you for actually planning out a winning solution vs just rapidly drawing lines like a maniac until you just happen to get one that works.

Other then that knock, a very fun little puzzle game that should keep you entertained for 10-20 minute sessions when you are bored.  Nothing too deep here, and certainly not likely a game that anyone will spend more then a half an hour at a time playing with.  However for it's price tag, this game is well worth it for puzzle game fans.

Two thumbs up based on the fact is a catchy little drawing/puzzle solving game that kinda fun for short periods of time, and the price is more then fair.

Even the shooter game and zombie slayers could use a game like this for the price tag.  For 1/10th the price of the next cookie cutter CoD expansion that should have been included with last November's game anyhow, a fun little challenging game that might work the brain a little can be had with this game  ;-)

40365505.review:
Je joue sur Linux. Version Linux : excellente.

[h1]Le jeu[/h1]

Un puzzle qui demande de tracer une ligne par niveau. Chaque fois que la ligne passe sur une case, elle change de couleur, il faut que toute la grille devienne blanche.

Niveau réalisation, rien à dire. C'est standard, mais efficace.

Pour ce qui est des puzzles, la difficulté est bien dosée. Ca commence facile, et ça se termine... plus difficile. J'ai jeté l'éponge sur les 10 derniers qui demandent tous de croiser les lignes à de nombreuses reprises, trop difficile pour mon petit cerveau en mousse. Certains sur la fin se révèlent tout de même plus faciles que d'autres, ou bien j'ai eu l'illumination rapidement...

[h1]Rejouabilité, achievements[/h1]

Il y a quelques achievements qui demandent de faire les niveaux d'une façon particulière. Aucun n'est compliqué, à part peut-être le dernier vu que je n'avais déjà pas réussi le niveau lui-même :).

On peut partager et jouer des niveaux du workshop, donc si vraiment vous êtes passionnés, c'est un bon point.

[h1]En bref[/h1]

Unium est un bon jeu, mais c'est rare que je jette l'éponge sur un puzzle, en général j'y reviens plus tard. Je ne le conseillerai donc pas, à moins que vous soyez convaincus par ce type de puzzle. Là, il y a trop de coups à prévoir à l'avance, et à chaque fois il faut refaire tout depuis le début... je crois que c'est ce qui m'a démotivé. Pouvoir bouger le point de départ de la ligne sans tout refaire m'aurait pas mal aidé je pense.

[h1]GNU/Linux[/h1]

La version Linux est excellente. Note: le jeu utilise Unity. Ce n'est pas une version très récente, et on ne peut pas spécifier sur quel écran lancer le jeu. Mais on peut bouger la fenêtre, donc rien de grave.

OS: Linux Mint 18.3 x64, MATE edition.
Hardware : i7 7700K OC@5Ghz, Nvidia 1080GTX, 32GB ram.
Screens : Triplescreen, dont un vertical, un seul screen X.
